title: Calculate MC and AVC from firm data

content.description: A profit-maximizing, perfectly competitive firm is currently in long-run equilibrium. It is earning $15,000 of total revenue from a sale of 1,000 units. Its total fixed cost of production is $2,500.
content.question: Which of the following can correctly be inferred from the information provided?

choices.label: Its marginal cost is $12.50, and its average total cost is $12.50.
Its marginal cost is $12.50, and its average variable cost is $12.50.
Its marginal cost is $15.00, and its average total cost is $12.50.
Its marginal cost is $15.00, and its average variable cost is $12.50.
Its marginal cost is $15.00, and its average fixed cost is $12.50.

content.answer: Its marginal cost is $15.00, and its average variable cost is $12.50.

unit.text: 3: Production, Cost, and the Perfect Competition Model

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
